DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to see if the study drug metformin will help patients who are overweight and have atrial fibrillation. This study aims to see if metformin helps patients stay in normal sinus rhythm after a catheter ablation. Metformin is investigational for use in patients with atrial fibrillation. Metformin is approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for use in patients with type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. Metformin is used with a proper diet and exercise program to control high blood sugar, and has been shown to help people lose weight. This study aims to look at the effects of metformin on weight loss and heart rhythm in patients with atrial fibrillation.
DOC.brief_title: Metformin as an Upstream Therapy in Atrial Fibrillation

All subjects must be able to understand and willing to sign a written informed consent document. Individuals who are already taking metformin or other antidiabetic medications including insulin, have a diagnosis of diabetes, have a known allergy or FDAlabeled contraindication to taking metformin, eGFR below 30 mL/min per 1.73 m2 or other clinical diagnosis of advanced renal disease,, have acute or chronic metabolic acidosis (serum bicarbonate <22 mEq/L), have a history of significant alcohol use (>2 drinks/day on average), have a history of hepatic dysfunction (serum bilirubin 1.5X greater than the upper limit of normal), have a history of New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III or IV heart failure, or are pregnant will be excluded from the trial.
